meanings.definition: The act of enclosing or surrounding something.
meanings.sent1: The encasement of the precious jewelry kept it safe.
meanings.sent2: The encasement of the gift made it look more presentable.
meanings.sent3: The encasement of the cookies in the jar tempted everyone in the room.
meanings.sent4: The encasement of the city in fog created a mysterious atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The encasement of the phone in a protective cover prevented it from getting scratched.

meanings.definition: A covering or case that encloses something.
meanings.sent1: The mattress encasement protected it from spills and stains.
meanings.sent2: The encasement of the camera lens kept it safe from dust.
meanings.sent3: The encasement of the sandwich in plastic wrap kept it fresh for lunch.
meanings.sent4: The encasement of the book in a leather cover added a touch of elegance.
meanings.sent5: The encasement of the fragile vase in bubble wrap prevented it from breaking during the move.

meanings.definition: The state of being enclosed or surrounded.
meanings.sent1: The encasement of the garden by tall trees provided a sense of privacy.
meanings.sent2: The encasement of the house by a fence made it feel secure.
meanings.sent3: The encasement of the classroom in silence allowed the students to focus.
meanings.sent4: The encasement of the city in snow transformed it into a winter wonderland.
meanings.sent5: The encasement of the park in darkness added an air of mystery to the night.
